fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Division algebras, (pseudo)orthogonal groups and spinors

html:blockquote.fr:p: The structure algebra of H_{3}(\mathbb {K}) is obtained from (3.18), as for H_{2}(\mathbb {K}); factoring out the one-dimensional center, we obtain \mathrm {Str'}H_{3}(\mathbb {K}) = L_{3}'(\mathbb {K})\oplus \mathrm {Der}(\mathbb {K})=\mathbf {sl}(3,\mathbb {K}) (this being a definition of \mathbf {sl}(3,\mathbb {K}) for non-associative \mathbb {K}). Equation (3.22) continues to hold for 3\times 3 matrices; hence the Lie brakcets in \mathbf {sl}(3,\mathbb {K}) are also given by (5.3) and (5.4). When \mathbb {K}=\mathbb {O}, this Lie algebra is a non-compact form of the exceptional Lie algebra \mathrm {E}_{6}, the maximal compact subalgebra being \mathrm {F}_{4}.
